data.description: <p>Required Qualifications:</p><ul><li>HS Diploma and some advanced level training. </li><li>U.S. Citizenship.</li><li>Have completed progress toward&nbsp;a bachelor&rsquo;s degree in computer science, computer engineering, or a related field.</li><li>Foundational experience in an object-oriented programming language, preferably in Java, and exposure to software engineering processes.</li><li>Hands on programming experience through coursework and/or prior internships.</li><li>Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.</li><li>Ability to quickly adapt and learn new technologies and concepts.</li><li>Self-motivated, independent, detail oriented, responsible team-player.</li><li>Strong written and oral communication skills.</li></ul><p>Desired Qualifications:</p><ul><li>3.0 and above GPA.</li><li>Exposure to Agile software development processes.</li><li>Familiarity with web development frameworks and/or database technologies.</li><li>Exposure to cloud computing environments.</li></ul><p>#PeratonIntern</p> <p>Peraton is seeking Summer 2026 Software Engineer Interns to support our Internal Research &amp; Development (IRAD) program which will be conducted in our Herndon, VA, West Lafayette, IN or Blacksburg, VA offices.&nbsp;</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>Join our Technology and Engineering Software Delivery Center and support exciting, advanced research projects in areas such as communications, space, cybersecurity, defense, health, and mobile. You&rsquo;ll have the opportunity to work in a collaborative, supportive environment with our full-time staff, allowing you to grow your skills and your career while building experience in a variety of different projects and domains. You&rsquo;ll work in an Agile software development environment supporting requirements/story development, software architecture and design, software development, and unit/component testing.&nbsp; You&rsquo;ll also get the chance to obtain certifications in leading technologies to enhance your skills, such as Amazon Web Services.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>We ask that each intern be available to work the duration of the ten weeks (June to August) and commit to working a minimum of 35-40 hours per week. This program is geared toward technical college students, actively enrolled at a four-year university, who will be rising into their junior or senior years. However, strong underclassmen may be considered if they have declared their major and have completed qualified coursework.</p>
